intro: Bupleurum karglii, commonly known as the Kargli bugloss, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small, white to pale blue, and appear in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Bupleurum karglii is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
